title: Sarah Michelle Gellar sparks MORE speculation of a Buffy remake as the cast reunite for the show's 20 year reunion
text:
Sarah Michelle Gellar sparks MORE speculation of a Buffy remake as the cast reunite for the show's 20 year reunion The actress shared behind the scenes shots of the cast's reunion for US mag Entertainment Weekly Share Sarah Michelle Gellar was thrilled to be back with her Buffy castmates (Photo: BBC/Twitter) Share Get daily   
Sarah Michelle Gellar - and the cast of Buffy The Vampire Slayer - have given the biggest hint yet that there could be a show remake. 
The actress, who played Buffy, tweeted a behind the scenes picture from a special reunion shoot and interview for US magazine Entertainment Weekly . 
Sarah Michelle posted a pic of backstage social media ban warnings, featuring the names of many of the cast of the hugely popular 90's series. 
Despite the bar, Sarah Michelle had snapped away and later made a lovely collage of nine individual signs taped to a surface featuring the names of cast and creators, including Seth Green (who played Oz), Michelle Trachtenberg (Dawn Summers), Emma Caulfield (Anya Jenkins), James Marsters (Spike), Amber Benson (Tara Maclay), Kristine Sutherland (Joyce Summers), Charisma Carpenter (Cordelia Chase), Nicolas Brendon (Xander Harris) and creator Joss Whedon- along with the caption, “But you know I had to take some… stay tuned”. Is Buffy the Vampire Slayer coming back? (Photo: Studio handout) The cast have been meeting up Sarah teased fans with this pic (Photo: SarahMGellar/Twitter) 
She then posted a series of images of her and David Boreanaz (Angel) saying “Reunited and it feels so good”, and the cover of the mag thrown in for good measure. 
The issue, which is out in America on Friday, reunites the hit show's cast and creator Joss Whedon for the first time in over a decade, to celebrate Buffy The Vampire Slayer's 20th anniversary. And it was a surreal experience, according to Whedon. 
“For the most part, this is like a high school reunion but much worse because they all still look really great," he told Entertainment Weekly." I was hoping some of them would puff out a bit. But that did not take place." Buffy (Sarah Michelle Gellar) falls into the loving arms of Angel (David Boreanaz) Video Loading
